p: This study found that many species were captured in small numbers that represented a high percentage of singletons (40.7%) and doubletons (14.5%) ( Figure 3b). Likewise, in other studies on communities of longhorn beetles, between 19.5 and 56% were presented by singleton species [ 11, 35, 45, 46, 47, 48]. A study from southern Yunnan, China, indicated that 166 of 193 species from a forest area were represented by only 1â€“6 specimens [ 16]. Moreover, this trend is also found in other insect groups that had a high proportion of singletons in samples, especially tropical insect species due to insufficient sampling [ 41]. The small number of longhorn beetles caught during this study may be explained by the limitation of the collecting method used. Malaise traps are unbiased and passive, and do not use attractants or bait.
